001package io.cyborgcode.roa.ui.selenium.helper;
002
003import io.cyborgcode.roa.ui.log.LogUi;
004import io.cyborgcode.roa.ui.selenium.exceptions.UiInteractionException;
005import io.cyborgcode.roa.ui.selenium.smart.SmartWebDriver;
006import io.cyborgcode.roa.ui.selenium.smart.SmartWebElement;
007import java.util.ArrayList;
008import java.util.List;
009import java.util.function.Function;
010import java.util.regex.Matcher;
011import java.util.regex.Pattern;
012import org.openqa.selenium.By;
013import org.openqa.selenium.WebDriver;
014import org.openqa.selenium.WebElement;
015import org.openqa.selenium.support.pagefactory.ByChained;
016
017/**
018 * Utility class for parsing and handling locators in Selenium.
019 *
020 * <p>This class provides methods for extracting locators from exception messages,
021 * updating WebElement references, and converting locator strings into By objects.
022 * </p>
023 *
024 * @author Cyborg Code Syndicate üíçüë®üíª
025 */
026public class LocatorParser {
027
028   private LocatorParser() {
029   }
030
031   private static final String LOCATOR_NOT_FOUND_MESSAGE = "Locator not found";
032   private static final String NO_MESSAGE_AVAILABLE = "No message available";
033
034   /**
035    * Updates the WebElement reference by parsing locators from the element string representation.
036    *
037    * @param driver  The WebDriver instance.
038    * @param element The SmartWebElement to relocate.
039    * @return A newly located SmartWebElement.
040    */
041   public static SmartWebElement updateWebElement(WebDriver driver, SmartWebElement element) {
042      LogUi.extended("Element: '{}' is being relocated.", element.toString());
043      List<By> locatorsList;
044      locatorsList = parseLocators(element.toString());
045      if (locatorsList.isEmpty()) {
046         throw new UiInteractionException("Element can't be auto updated");
047      }
048      return new SmartWebDriver(driver).findSmartElement(
049            new ByChained(locatorsList.toArray(new By[0])), 10);
050   }
051
052   /**
053    * Extracts the blocking element locator from an exception message.
054    *
055    * @param exceptionMessage The exception message containing locator details.
056    * @return The XPath locator of the blocking element.
057    */
058   public static String extractBlockingElementLocator(String exceptionMessage) {
059      String pattern = "Other element would receive the click: <(\\w++)([^>]*+)>";
060      Matcher matcher = Pattern.compile(pattern).matcher(exceptionMessage);
061      if (matcher.find()) {
062         String tag = matcher.group(1);
063         String attributes = matcher.group(2).trim();
064         if (attributes.isEmpty()) {
065            return "//" + tag;
066         }
067         String[] attrPairs = attributes.split("\\s+");
068         @SuppressWarnings("java:S1075")
069         StringBuilder xpath = new StringBuilder("//" + tag + "[");
070         for (int i = 0; i < attrPairs.length; i++) {
071            String[] keyValue = attrPairs[i].split("=");
072            if (keyValue.length == 2) {
073               String key = keyValue[0];
074               String value = keyValue[1].replace("\"", "").replace("'", "");
075               xpath.append("@").append(key).append("='").append(value).append("'");
076               if (i < attrPairs.length - 1) {
077                  xpath.append(" and ");
078               }
079            }
080         }
081         xpath.append("]");
082         return xpath.toString();
083      } else {
084         throw new IllegalArgumentException("Can't extract locator from exception message: " + exceptionMessage + ".");
085      }
086   }
087
088   /**
089    * Extracts a locator from a given array of arguments.
090    *
091    * @param args The array containing locator arguments.
092    * @return The extracted By locator, or null if not found.
093    */
094   public static By extractLocator(Object[] args) {
095      if (args != null && args.length > 0 && args[0] instanceof By by) {
096         return by;
097      }
098      return null;
099   }
100
101   /**
102    * Extracts a locator from an exception message.
103    *
104    * @param message The exception message.
105    * @return The extracted locator string, or a default message if not found.
106    */
107   public static String extractLocatorFromMessage(String message) {
108      if (message == null) {
109         return NO_MESSAGE_AVAILABLE;
110      }
111      String locatorPattern = "By\\.(\\w+)\\((.*?)\\)";
112      Pattern pattern = Pattern.compile(locatorPattern);
113      Matcher matcher = pattern.matcher(message);
114      return matcher.find() ? matcher.group() : LOCATOR_NOT_FOUND_MESSAGE;
115   }
116
117   /**
118    * Retrieves detailed information about a WebElement.
119    *
120    * @param element   The target WebElement.
121    * @param outerHtml The outer HTML representation of the element.
122    * @param innerHtml The inner HTML representation of the element.
123    * @return A formatted string with element details.
124    */
125   public static String getElementDetails(WebElement element, String outerHtml, String innerHtml) {
126      String tag = element.getTagName();
127      String text = element.getText();
128      return String.format("Tag: [%s]%nText: [%s]%nOuter HTML: [%s]%nInner HTML: [%s]",
129            tag, text, outerHtml, innerHtml);
130   }
131
132   /**
133    * Parses locators from a locator string representation.
134    *
135    * @param locatorString The string representation of locators.
136    * @return A list of By locators extracted from the string.
137    */
138   private static List<By> parseLocators(String locatorString) {
139      String[] parts = locatorString.split("->");
140      List<By> byList = new ArrayList<>();
141      for (int i = 1; i < parts.length; i++) {
142         String trimmed = parts[i].trim();
143         addLocatorIfMatches(byList, trimmed, "tag name", By::tagName);
144         addLocatorIfMatches(byList, trimmed, "css selector", By::cssSelector);
145         addLocatorIfMatches(byList, trimmed, "xpath", By::xpath);
146         addLocatorIfMatches(byList, trimmed, "id", By::id);
147         addLocatorIfMatches(byList, trimmed, "class name", By::className);
148         addLocatorIfMatches(byList, trimmed, "name", By::name);
149         addLocatorIfMatches(byList, trimmed, "link text", By::linkText);
150         addLocatorIfMatches(byList, trimmed, "partial link text", By::partialLinkText);
151      }
152      return byList;
153   }
154
155   /**
156    * Adds a locator to the list if the given key matches a known locator type.
157    *
158    * @param locatorList     The list to which the locator should be added.
159    * @param locatorText     The locator text representation.
160    * @param key             The key representing a locator type.
161    * @param locatorFunction The function to generate a By locator.
162    */
163   private static void addLocatorIfMatches(List<By> locatorList, String locatorText, String key,
164                                           Function<String, By> locatorFunction) {
165      if (locatorText.split(":")[0].equals(key)) {
166         String locator = extractLocatorValue(locatorText);
167         locatorList.add(locatorFunction.apply(locator));
168      }
169   }
170
171   /**
172    * Extracts the value of a locator from its text representation.
173    *
174    * @param locatorText The text containing the locator value.
175    * @return The extracted locator value.
176    */
177   private static String extractLocatorValue(String locatorText) {
178      String[] parts = locatorText.split(":");
179      String value = parts[1].trim();
180      return value.substring(0, value.length() - 2);
181   }
182}
